title: By the King. A proclamation to declare, that the procez of green waxe may be sealed at Oxford as well as at London, for the Courts of Kings-Bench, Common-Pleas and Exchequer during these times of this unhappy distraction.
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
publisher: by Leonard Lichfield printer to the University,
notes: At foot of title: Given at his Majesties Court at Oxford, this twelfth day of October, 1643.
Because of the irregularities of the times, seals will be kept in London and in Oxford.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
